value: Title page for "Nouvelle Suitte de Cahiers de fleurs iéales"

label: Description
value: An enframement of flowers, heart-shaped, in colors, encloses eight lines of the title: "Nouvelle Suite de / Cahiers de fleurs ideales, / a l'usage des dessinateurs / et des peintres, inventés / et dessinés par / jean pillement / gravés par anne Allen"

label: Physical description
value: Etching a la poupée and teal, orange, pink, purple, and aquamarine ink on paper

label: Description
value: A couple promenading in the woods, left. Before them, moving toward the right, a small girl is seated on a donkey, accompanied by a young woman holding a parasol; a doll seated on another donkey, led by a little girl.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and sepia wash on paper

label: Description
value: A coach passes the gate to a villa. Two girls, each with a doll in her lap, are seen in the coach. A crown is painted on the coach door.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and bistre ink, brush and ink wash, brush and white heightening on cream-colored paper

label: Description
value: A girl with a doll in her arms stands in a doorway and looks back to a cart filled with household furniture seen entering a courtyard.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and bistre ink, brush and ink wash, brush and white heightening on cream-colored paper

label: Description
value: Vignette of a woman standing, center, with her left hand resting on her hip. At left, a man dances. At right, a musician is seated.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and sepia and gray wash on paper

label: Description
value: Two women in contemporary costume. At left, a woman is seated at a pianoforte, her back to spectator. At right, another woman is seated at a harp, her figure facing right. Probably illustration for "Le Follet Courrier des Salons."

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and sepia wash on paper
The Catologue of the artist's work (Table of Contents of the Vedute di Roma)

label: Description
value: Unrecorded; Hind, p. 6 (14). Arranged like a bulletin board with lists, beginning "Antichita Romane" nailed over examples of his work, notably the view of St. Peter's in Rome. Ornaments and fragments of classical details lie in the foreground. Left top corner, a tablet with inscription "CATALOGO . DELLE. OPERE/ DATE . FINORA . ALLA . LUCE/ DA GIO BATTISTA PIRANESI ..." Two framing lines. Bottom center: "Si vendono presso il medesimo Autore nel palazzo del conte Tomati a Strada Felice vicino alla Trinita de Monti." Bottom margin : continuation of catalogue to No. 94, where the hand changes, and then in three columns to No.137, which reads: "Statue di Meleagro del Museo Vaticano ..." A fourth column separated from these , at right.
Portrait of Sarah Cooper Hewitt in French Costume

label: Description
value: Three quarter portrait of a woman wearing a black hat, facing left. She is dressed in a blue coat, yellow skirt and white jabot. On her right arm she supports a brass hunting horn.

label: Physical description
value: Pastel on paper mounted on linen

label: Description
value: Portrait bust of a woman in a white bonnet, wearing a pink fur-lined robe with white ruffles, in oval trompe l’oeil frame.

label: Description
value: A seated woman and a standing man are shown in the left foreground. He points at the group of Italian houyses in the middle plane and background.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and ink, brush and gray watercolor, brush and wash on paper

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, gray, black wash, graphite Support: white laid paper
Study of man, woman and child heads, sitting child

label: Description
value: At left above is the man’s head turned toward the right. In the center is the child upright sitting as in a bed. At right, above, a woman’s profile, as copied after an antique statue; in the center a child’s head looking upward, seen in three-quarter front.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on light brown paper

label: Description
value: The proportions are stressing the height. In the left half the upper part of the apsis is indicated. Captions above either half, written with ink.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and gray and black wash on paper

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle with the general outline of a harp, a bust of a girl and a shell are in the upper left corner.  An upper field consists of a shell on a stalactite ground.  A lower irregular field looks as if cut out.  Reverse: three concentric circles.

label: Physical description
value: Black and red crayon on paper

value: Vertical rectangle, leaf scrolls on top, the field has the general outline of a pedestal.

value: Black and red crayon on paper

label: Provenance

label: Description
value: A hilly wooded landscape. Figures with farm animals in the foreground, one on horseback crossing a stream.

label: Description
value: Bust portrait of Abram S. Hewitt (1822-1903) seated in a chair, facing to the left, with his right hand raised to his head.

label: Description
value: Back legs flat-sided, front legs flat excepting rounded front face.  Legs curve outward toward bottom, and back legs inclue toward each other at bottom.  Back side corner posts terminate at top in an elementary volute form.  Flat top rail bowed toward back, slightly arched, with rectangular panel of inset veneer surrounded by beading.  Horizontal splat is composed of a small oblong shape faced with veneer, flanked on either side by horizontal coupled C-scrolls deeply carved with foliage, terminating in volutes.  Double-curved arms, resting on in-curved supports of one piece with front leg.  Seat flares from back to front, with straight edges.

label: Physical description
value: Turned joined mahogany-veneered oak, horse hair upholstery (probably replaced)

label: Description
value: Back legs flat-sided, front legs flat excepting rounded front face; legs curve outward toward bottom, and back legs incline toward each other at bottom.  The chair's back corner posts terminate in a volute-like form at the top of the chair.   The chair's top rail, slightly arched, is bowed towards the back.  A rectangular panel of inset veneer is surrounded by beading.  The chair's splat is horizontal, composed of a small oblong-shaped rectangle faced with veneer, flanked on either side by horizontal coupled C-scrolls covered with foliage.  The C-scrolls terminate in volutes.  The seat flares from back to front, with straight edges.

The chair's splat is horizontal, composed of a small oblong-shaped rectangle faced with veneer, flanked on either side by horizontal coupled C-scrolls covered with foliage.  The C-scrolls terminate in volutes.  The seat flares from back to front, with straight edges.
